body:
Comment 5: 
Yes, gccgo does incorrectly accept this program.  You're right, I shouldn't have closed
it, I should have turned it into a gccgo bug.

Gccgo accepts this because when the parser sees Int{0} it knows that Int is a type, so
it knows how to parse the code.  If the definition of Int is moved after the function,
gccgo produces some rather horrible parse errors, pretty similar to 6g actually.
_Labels changed: added **priority-later**, **gccgo**, removed **priority-triage**._
